question: Which of the following statements are true regarding the statefulness of security groups and network ACLs? (Choose two)

answers.A: Security groups are stateful and allow responses to allowed traffic, even if the security group’s rules don’t permit it.
answers.B: Security groups are stateful and allow responses to allowed traffic, only if the security group’s rules permit it.
answers.C: Network ACLs are stateless and allow responses to allowed traffic, subject to network ACL rules.
answers.D: Network ACLs are stateless and allow responses to allowed traffic, regardless of the network ACL rules.
